alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 12:43PM MST until June 25 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1240 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Heavy rain has ended across the warned area with only light showers remaining. There is ash laden flow being reported in area washes. Flash flooding is expected to continue over the next few hours. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... areas along and north of Copeland Lane including Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Timberline, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Lockett Meadow Campground and Sunset Crater Visitors Center. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 427 and 430. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
